Class Matcher

Provides methods to check if some condition is true. This API is inspired by Jest.

Hierarchy

  • Matcher
  • Defined in packages/core/src/testplan/hierarchy.ts:36

Methods

toBe

  • toBe(expected: unknown): boolean

  • Compares two values for equality.

    Most types of objects should be supported:

    • If both values are numbers, numericEquals is used, which supports floats.

    • Otherwise, the isEqual function from lodash is used. Quoting their docs:

      This method supports comparing arrays, array buffers, booleans, date objects, error objects, maps, numbers, Object objects, regexes, sets, strings, symbols, and typed arrays. Object objects are compared by their own, not inherited, enumerable properties. Functions and DOM nodes are not supported.

    Returns

    The value of the test.

    Parameters

    • expected: unknown

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in packages/core/src/testplan/hierarchy.ts:69

toMatch

  • toMatch(blockPattern: Pattern<PatternBlock>): boolean

  • Match the value against a pattern.

    In this case, the value must be a Node, or it will throw, as this is considered a programming error.

    Parameters

    • blockPattern: Pattern<PatternBlock>

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in packages/core/src/testplan/hierarchy.ts:81

toMatchSubtree

  • toMatchSubtree(stackPattern: Pattern<BlockScript>): boolean

  • Match the value against a subtree.

    In this case, the value must be a Node, or it will throw, as this is considered a programming error.

    Parameters

    • stackPattern: Pattern<BlockScript>

    Returns boolean

    • Defined in packages/core/src/testplan/hierarchy.ts:97

toNotBe

  • toNotBe(expected: unknown): boolean

  • Compares two values for equality.

    Most types of objects should be supported:

    • If both values are numbers, numericEquals is used, which supports floats.

    • Otherwise, the isEqual function from lodash is used. Quoting their docs:

      This method supports comparing arrays, array buffers, booleans, date objects, error objects, maps, numbers, Object objects, regexes, sets, strings, symbols, and typed arrays. Object objects are compared by their own, not inherited, enumerable properties. Functions and DOM nodes are not supported.

    Returns

    The value of the test.

    Parameters

    • expected: unknown

    Returns boolean
